citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The CEO of the facility has failed to appoint a new IACUC chairman since the last chairman retired at the end of last year.
With a required IACUC position unfilled, there is not a properly constituted IACUC. An improperly constituted IACUC
cannot perform the functions required by the Animal Welfare Act. The members of the IACUC committee shall be
appointed by the CEO and be composed of a Chairman and at least two additional members.
Correct by April 7th 2023

citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The last facility program review by the IACUC was performed 4/13/22. It is essential that this program review be
conducted every 6 months in order to ensure the humane and judicious use of animals by the facility. The IACUC shall
review, at least once every six months, the research facility's program for humane care and use of animals.
Corrected by 4/6/23

citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The last facility review by the IACUC was performed 4/13/22. It is essential that the IACUC conduct a facility review every
6 months in order to ensure humane and judicious use of animals by the facility. The IACUC shall inspect, at least once
every six months, all of the animal facilities including animal study areas.
Corrected by 4/6/23

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care.
citations.narrative:
The facility acquired rabbits approximately 2 weeks prior to the IACUC meeting on 2/15/23. The Attending
Veterinarian(AV) was under the impression that studies involving rabbits were not planned in the future, and was unaware
that the study plan had changed until arriving at the facility for the IACUC meeting. The lack of communication between
the facility and the attending veterinarian could result in an inability to recognize, diagnose, and treat diseases or injuries.
A mechanism of direct and frequent communication is required so that timely and accurate information on problems of
animal health, behavior, and well-being is being conveyed to the attending veterinarian.
Correct by March 21, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
End Section

narrative:
2.31(b)(2) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
The CEO of the facility has failed to appoint a new IACUC chairman since the last chairman retired at the end of last year.  
With a required IACUC position unfilled, there is not a properly constituted IACUC. An improperly constituted IACUC 
cannot perform the functions required by the Animal Welfare Act. The members of the IACUC committee shall be 
appointed by the CEO and be composed of a Chairman and at least two additional members. 
 
Correct by April 7th 2023 
2.31(c)(1) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
The last facility program review by the IACUC was performed 4/13/22. It is essential that this program review be 
conducted every 6 months in order to ensure the humane and judicious use of animals by the facility. The IACUC shall 
review, at least once every six months, the research facility's program for humane care and use of animals. 
 
Corrected by 4/6/23 
2.31(c)(2)

Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
The last facility review by the IACUC was performed 4/13/22. It is essential that the IACUC conduct a facility review every 
6 months in order to ensure humane and judicious use of animals by the facility. The IACUC shall inspect, at least once 
every six months, all of the animal facilities including animal study areas. 
 
Corrected by 4/6/23 
2.33(b)(3) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care. 
The facility acquired rabbits approximately 2 weeks prior to the IACUC meeting on 2/15/23. The Attending 
Veterinarian(AV) was under the impression that studies involving rabbits were not planned in the future, and was unaware 
that the study plan had changed until arriving at the facility for the IACUC meeting. The lack of communication between 
the facility and the attending veterinarian could result in an inability to recognize, diagnose, and treat diseases or injuries. 
A mechanism of direct and frequent communication is required so that timely and accurate information on problems of 
animal health, behavior, and well-being is being conveyed to the attending veterinarian.   
 
Correct by March 21, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
End Section
